revised_title: Sir Hans Sloane: A Pivotal Figure in the History of the Royal Society and the British Museum
scientific_discipline: Biographies and Book Reviews > History of Science
tldr: This article discusses the life and contributions of Sir Hans Sloane, a key figure in the history of the Royal Society and the British Museum. Sloane was a Fellow of the Royal Society for 68 years and served as its President from 1727 to 1741. He played a crucial role in maintaining the Society's position during challenging times and helped improve its financial situation. Sloane's interests spanned various scientific fields, including botany, zoology, and medicine. His extensive collections formed the basis of the British Museum.
